meanings.definition: Make universal; apply to all cases or situations.
meanings.sent1: Teachers aim to universalize their teaching methods to benefit all students.
meanings.sent2: The goal is to universalize access to education for everyone, regardless of their background.
meanings.sent3: Trying to universalize the concept of bedtime to teenagers can be quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to universalize the idea of kindness, spreading it like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The campaign sought to universalize the importance of recycling in every household.

meanings.definition: To make universal in scope or application.
meanings.sent1: The company's mission is to universalize their products, making them available worldwide.
meanings.sent2: They plan to universalize their policies to ensure consistency across all branches.
meanings.sent3: Attempting to universalize the use of emojis in professional emails could lead to confusion.
meanings.sent4: His vision was to universalize the concept of peace, making it a reality for all nations.
meanings.sent5: The artist aimed to universalize her art, reaching audiences from every corner of the globe.
